Suppose the following is true: Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, a national election in a G7 country (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, or the United States) officially uses machine learning algorithms for real-time vote counting, confirmed by the national electoral authority and reported by reputable news sources. Then, given this condition, will an AI system pass the Turing Test before January 1, 2028? The Turing Test must be passed between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, as defined by a panel of experts in AI and verified by a reputable organization such as the Alan Turing Institute or the AAAI.
